data.name: AddEmpWithSinPh_TestAction.SqlScript
testCleanupAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here that you want to run after each test method (unit test) in this test class is run.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @EmpPhones AS TABLE ( EmpId INT, PhoneEntId UNIQUEIDENTIFIER ) DECLARE @PhoneId AS TABLE ( PhoneId INT ) DECLARE @MaxPhoneId INT
INSERT @EmpPhones (EmpId, PhoneEntId) SELECT EmployeeId, EntityPhoneId FROM Stores.Employee WHERE EmployeeId > 1
DELETE ep OUTPUT deleted.PhoneId INTO @PhoneId FROM Stores.EmployeePhone ep INNER JOIN @EmpPhones eph ON ep.EntityPhoneId = eph.PhoneEntId
DELETE FROM Stores.Phone WHERE PhoneId IN ( SELECT PhoneId FROM @PhoneId )
DELETE FROM Stores.Employee WHERE EmployeeId > 1
DBCC CHECKIDENT ('Stores.Employee', RESEED, 1)
SELECT @MaxPhoneId = MAX(PhoneId) FROM Stores.Phone
DBCC CHECKIDENT ('Stores.Phone', RESEED, @MaxPhoneId)

data.name: AddEmpWithMulPh_TestAction.SqlScript
AddEmpWithInvPh_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
-- database unit test for Stores.uspAddEmployee DECLARE @Employee AS XML(CONTENT [Stores].[EmployeeXMLSchema]); SET @Employee = ' <Employee IsManager="1" Designation="Manager" BloodGroup="O+" StoreId="1"> <FirstName>TestFN</FirstName> <LastName>TestLN</LastName> <ReportingManager>1</ReportingManager> <Address> <AddressLine1>Address1</AddressLine1> <AddressLine2>Address2</AddressLine2> <AddressLine3>Address3</AddressLine3> </Address> <PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">+918983879706</Phone> <Phone IsPrimary="0">+919A44577980</Phone> <Phone IsPrimary="0">+919880065456</Phone> </PhoneNumbers> </Employee>'
EXECUTE [Stores].[uspAddEmployee] @Employee;

data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */ DECLARE @Employee AS XML(DOCUMENT [Stores].[EmployeeXMLSchema]), @parent hierarchyid; SET @Employee = ' <Employee IsManager="1" Designation="Manager" BloodGroup="O+" StoreId="2"> <FirstName>MANFN1</FirstName> <LastName>MANLN1</LastName> <ReportingManager>1</ReportingManager> <Address> <AddressLine1>Address1</AddressLine1> <AddressLine2>Address2</AddressLine2> <AddressLine3>Address3</AddressLine3> </Address> <PhoneNumbers> <Phone IsPrimary="1">+918983879708</Phone> </PhoneNumbers> </Employee>'
EXECUTE [Stores].[uspAddEmployee] @Employee, @TransferEmp = 1;
SELECT COUNT(1) AS Cnt FROM [Stores].[Employee] WHERE FirstName = 'MANFN1' AND LastName = 'MANLN1' AND IsManager = 1
SELECT @parent = OrgPath FROM [Stores].[Employee] WHERE FirstName = 'MANFN1' AND LastName = 'MANLN1' AND IsManager = 1
SELECT EmployeeId FROM [Stores].Employee WHERE StoreId = 2 AND FirstName IN ('EMPFN2', 'EMPFN1') AND OrgPath.IsDescendantOf(@parent) = 1
